greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: If n == 0 or A008683(n) == 0, then a(n) = 0, otherwise a(n) = 1+a(A048675(n)); number of iterations of A048675 needed before the result is either zero or nonsquarefree number (A013929).
comment: Conjecture: all terms are well-defined (finite). This implies also the conjecture I have made in A019565.
formula: If n == 0 or A008683(n) == 0, then a(n) = 0, otherwise a(n) = 1+a(A048675(n)).
example: a(38) = 3 because 38 = 2*19 (thus squarefree), A048675(38) = 129 (= 3*43), A048675(129) = 8194 (= 2*17*241) and A048675(8194) = 4503599627370561 (= 3^2 * 37 * 71 * 190483425427), so three steps were needed before nonsquarefree number was reached.
program: A048675(n) = my(f = factor(n)); sum(k=1, #f~, f[k, 2]*2^primepi(f[k, 1]))/2; \\ _Michel Marcus_, Oct 10 2016
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Apr 18 2017
